headline: Pineapple Crisp
description: This pineapple recipe makes a delicious tropical and juicy crisp made with crushed pineapple layered with a buttery, brown sugar, cinnamon topping.

video.description: A super-simple fruit crisp gets the tropical treatment.
video.name: Pineapple Crisp

name: Pineapple Crisp

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Spread well-drained pineapple into a 9x9-inch square baking pan.

Mix together flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and egg in a medium bowl until well combined and crumbly. Spoon mixture evenly over pineapple. Pour melted butter over mixture, then sprinkle with cinnamon.
Bake in the preheated oven until top is lightly browned and filling is bubbly, 40 to 45 minutes. Serve hot or cold.

review.reviewBody: Thanks for sharing this recipe which is delicious. Next time I may add some nuts and coconut.
OMG it is to die for.

It’s an absolutely delicious recipe and everyone I’ve made it for loves it. However I reduce the sugar by half and use 3/4 of the flour required, replacing 1/4 cup or the flour with desiccated coconut to give it a delicious coconut chewy flavor. Serve hot with icecream and boom! Exposing tastebuds guaranteed

I made this with a few changes. 1) I used pineapple chunks and tossed them with some brown sugar (they were more on the tart side) and some cornstarch (to thicken up any remaining liquid after draining) 2) instead of pouring melted butter on top I chopped some butter and then dotted the top. Everything else was the same. The kids really dug it, would absolutely make again. I really liked the texture of the crust

So good! Will be baking this again. A few tweaks, I used a long casserole dish since I had so much pineapple, 1/2 stick of chopped cold butter and sprinkled a little bit of oats on top before baking. Thanks for an easy and delicious recipe!
This recipe is perfect! Made it for a dinner party and the guests loved it. It was all gone in few minutes. The only change I made was substituting 1 cup flour for 1/2 cup of flour and 1/2 cup oats.
My husband and I loved this..wonderful with vanilla ice cream or cool whip

Pineapple, I love pineapple! I made this with one fresh pineapple. This was easy to make and tastes delicious. I already had everything In my cupboards to make this which made it so simple. Well except an egg but what crazy person doesn’t have eggs. I was actually at the store yesterday and thought to myself “hmm I should get eggs” but decided I would wait since we don’t eat eggs very often. But I did get me a pineapple because, well you know, I said it at the beginning of my review. I guess not getting eggs was a mistake because as I was checking out allrecipes.com I found this gem of a recipe. Luckily I have a non crazy neighbor that was able to provide the one measly egg needed for this recipe. No running to the store which was nice. Although running the store would have been a good idea so I could burn some of the calories I consumed eating this delicious dessert. Honestly though I’m not sure the egg was needed. Im thinking I could have just cut the butter in the flour/sugar mixture and it would have worked out. Eh regardless it was still good and I would make it as written again. Well Except maybe less butter. I think the butter could probably be reduced without anyone knowing the difference. I don’t know about you but I could do with fewer calories. I think this would be great with apples or peaches as well. Now I’m off to provide my lovely neighbor with a bowl of this deliciousness for making it possibly for me to enjoy this delightful dessert on my lunch break.

I made this recipe because I had some fresh pineapple in my fridge. I also put some coconut with the pineapple and made it in a loaf baking pan. It tastes delicious I hope my boy friend loves it or at least enjoys. It’s an easy and quick recipe to make. I will be making ut for my mom next time.
Very good. I added chopped Maraschino Cherries . I would for sure make this again and serve it to guests . I also put whipped cream on top.
Omitted egg, used fresh pineapple, cut back on sugar, and mixed cold butter to make a crumble topping.
This is delectable!! I will make it again many times I'm sure.
Solid recipe, great with fresh pineapple. I added equal parts clove and nutmeg in with the cinnamon. Turned out great.

This one gets four stars, only because I am not a big pineapple fan. But in terms of recipe design, it's a definite winner. My family larger ignored the final product, so I have consumed all but one piece. The success of this recipe is the mixing of the top crust as the gooey pineapple underneath. This is a great dessert to make if you are looking for something a little off the beaten path, particularly if your family are guests have an adventuresome bone in their body.
Easy to make. Tastes great. I added pineapple juice to flour mixture.

Delicious way to use up fresh pineapple! I used the food processor to “crush” the pineapple. Sorry about the few changes ,I cut the butter down to a 1/4 cup,added about 1/2 cup whole oats to the flour mixture trying to make it a little healthier??and the recipe was wonderful! I’ll use this recipe as a base for other fruits too. Thank you!

I added some oats and vanilla to the topping. Also, I mixed the butter and cinnamon into the topping instead of pouring/sprinkling it over the top. It's very good! Consistency is a cross between a crisp and a cobbler which I think was intended as crisps don't typically have egg in them. I will likely add coconut flakes next time too cause I love the flavor together. Fun recipe and a great way to have a pineapple dessert that's not as sweet as upside down cake. ??

Made this with an old fashioned crumble recipe (brown sugar, oats, flour, butter, cinnamon) and used fresh pineapple to replace the canned pineapple. SERVED this at thanks giving and everyone said the crumble was the best part. The pineapple didn’t belong, will not make again with pineapple.

I used fresh pineapple that I had on hand. I accidentally mixed the cinnamon into the crumb mixture instead of sprinkling on top as recipe said but it turned out great like that. I also used a little vanilla extract and used half white and half brown sugar. Easy and quite delicious!

This desert turned out Fantastic !!! I made it mostly by the directions, the few changes I made was to add about a tbsp of Almond extract, added chopped Pecans to the topping and added a bit of the pineapple juice to the topping along with divided the melted butter between the topping mixture itself and the rest directly on top of the topping ... also added more of the ground cinnamon in the mixture and also on top of the butter poured directly on top ... It was So good, not overly sweet at all !!!

I had some fresh pineapple that was starting to ferment. It worked great for this recipe. I loved the crumble topping. I'm sure this recipe would work well with mango, bananas and other tropical fruit that is starting to be less desirable in a fruit salad.

Personally, I would have given it 4 stars because I didn't love the texture (probably because I'm more accustomed to the denser topping similar to an apple crisp with oats) but everyone I served it to raved about it! And these were family members who would be the most honest, not polite guests! Lol! The flavour was delicious
Absolutely delicious. Simple to make. I like the crisp part so well I will use it for other crisp recipes.
Followed recipe w butter adjustment and it came out quite dry. Was fair overall.
I added some mandarin orange slices. Happy with results.
Awesome!
It was Great! Made it just as the recipe said. Will be a new go to quick dessert.

This is wonderful and very pantry-friendly for a quick treat. Made this today exactly as written, with a cup of toasted, chopped pecans tossed in with the topping before baking. It turned out delicious and will become a trusted recipe that won’t let you down. It’s very quick, makes your house smell wonderful and is nice enough for company. Kids love this. What’s not to love?! Thanks for the recipe.
I used 1 can of pineapple vs 2 because I love the crunch!

Oh, my....this was perfect and the recipe needs no alterations if using sweetened canned pineapple . My husband usually turns his nose up at cobblers and crisps, so I served it to him without telling him what it was and he LOVED it!!!

NOTE: if you are using FRESH pineapple, you will need to add sugar to the pineapple. Some reviewers left a neg review but the instructions do say to use canned....so if you are not going to do that, it's up to you to add sugar! I think I would do the same if using a "no sugar added" can of pineapple.
I modified the recipe by only using 1/4 tsp salt since I used salted butter. I also mixed all ingredients together and poured into a 9 oz. Graham cracker pie crust. YUMMY!
Super easy and delicious! Even without ice cream or whipped cream it was very yummy!! Definitely going to make double batch next time
I made this recipe with fresh pineapples and boy was it delicious! The recipe is so simple, I made it again but substituted the pineapples with frozen mixed berries - delicious too!
WOW! This was an amazing pineapple crisp. My whole family ate it up within two days! I am sure to make this again because it is easy and does not call for many ingredients. Thanks for this recipe!
awesome recipe. What I did differently: added 1 cup of oats to the mixture and it gave more crunch to every bite :)

Egg in a crisp recipe I admit seemed different, but this was delicious, my husband absolutely devoured it.
I used only 1 can of crushed pineapple and added 1 kiwi. I made more crisp mix but not exactly doubled, and I just mixed the melted butter in with it. Delish!

Anything pineapple usually works for me and this really works, I added some extra pineapple as a topping I threw on after baking to add just a bit more pineapple deliciousness to it. Thanks for the recipe.
Followed recipe exactly and hubby loved it!!!

This was a quick and easy way to use up a fresh pineapple that I didn’t want to waste! My kids typically want fruit crisps over cobblers (with cinnamon oatmeal topping) so this was a little different for them, but loved by all! My only substitution was the fresh pineapple instead of canned, but I might try adding grated coconut to the pineapple next time. And maybe a little more cinnamon! Definitely a keeper!
Used canned peaches and called it “cobbler. Mm mmm
We really enjoyed the flavor of this crisp. It wasn't too sweet. It was easy to make too. Will have it again for sure!

Delicious, simple, quick, and so satisfying with some ice cream. The only adjustments I made was halving the pineapple amount because I was worried about it fitting in my small pan. I did everything else according the recipe and was very happy with the results for my first cobbler/crisp dessert.

I gave it 5 stars - 4 stars because it is quick, easy and good. And 1 extra star because the recipe is a good base for something a little different.

As written, it was a little sweet, so I suggest you lessen the amount of sugar.

Also I took some of the mixture (about a third) and adden a little leftover pineapple juice in the topping so it resembled a slightly thick cake batter. I cook it along with the original.

The original was like you would expect a crumble or crisp to be. The second was more like upside down cake.

I had such high hopes for this recipe, and then went into a panic when I was not able to "stir until smooth" as the recipe instructs since the only liquid for 1 cup each of flour and sugar is a single egg. Fear not! This turned out wonderfully. The butter soaked into my dry grainy crumbles and the oven did its magic and what came out was essentially pineapple upside down cake without the cake or cherries. Ends up that's exactly what I was looking for. So this gets 4 stars from me, losing one for not accurately presenting how the dry ingredients will come together. Full marks for deliciousness.

This was so delicious & ridiculously easy to make! I read some of the reviews & followed not doing a full half cup of melted butter. Also, of the quarter cup , I used half pure unrefined cold pressed Coconut Oil & half butter. The crust was perfect!
Really delicious. I used fresh pineapple and added toasted walnuts to the topping.
This dessert is definitely a keeper....it was delicious!
Easy to make, tastes great and all the kids loved it!

I made this to use up some canned pineapple and pears. Took other reviewers' suggestions and decreased the brown sugar and butter by about half. So easy to put together that I got it in the oven while dinner was cooking on the stove. It smelled so good during baking! Turned out just as I'd hoped. Kids and I loved it!! Definitely saving the recipe.

Thank you for this. I also only added only 1/2 cup of sugar and it was perfect. I also added a sprinkle of shredded coconut and dried oats too. Worked very well. Also, my oven it only needed to be in for 12 mins!! Not much cooking required at all.
Good and Easy. Just a little too sweet will do less on sugars next time.
great recipe! made my boyfriend's juice taste really yummy and sweeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeet! XD RAWR
This recipe should be called Pineapple Cobbler, for there is a batter dalloped on it. Crisps have rolled oats, flour, sugars, etc.
Trying to make all that flour and sugar mixture smooth with just one egg seemed impossible to me so I added another egg. that made the batter easier to work with. It turned out great!

This recipe is perfect as written. So easy and tasty! Next time I won't drain my pineapple so much but leave just a little juice to mix with the butter. I used the drained juice to marinate chicken for skewers on the BBQ.
This is fabulous! The second time I made it I added some oats to the topping and a pound of strawberries to the pineapple! Yummy! Next time I'm going to add rhubarb to the pineapple!
I only used one 20 ounce can of crushed pineapple (it was all I had at the time in the pantry) and it tasted fabulous!
Made it just as written. Yummy!!
Blended the pineapple because I did not have crushed. I would definitely make this again. Very easy!

I wouldn't know because the "pour melted butter " on after was not a separate step which it should be. Now I think I will have pineapple goop, but I'm sure it will still taste good so whatever. Will probably try this again but to those who contribute recipes, please keep steps that clearly stand alone separate.
Really delicious! I was sceptical but made it just as the recipe said, only with fresh pinapple. The egg added a nice consistency to the topping.
This was delicious and easy easy easy. Definitely making it again!

These directions are incorrect. The directions say to mix the ingredients "until smooth". However, when you view the directions on the video, it shows that when you mix the ingredients together it becomes granular. Mine was not smooth (it was granular) so I added another egg to make it smooth. Consequently, the crisp became "cakey". I didn't check the video until after it was done baking.
This was easy to make and very tasty! I too used fresh pineapple. I will definitely make again.

Excellent sweet desert for those who love the flavor of pineapple upside down cake but with a crisp instead! Made forty servings with rice flour in place of traditional flour. Also added raisin granola and a splash of vanilla to the crisp mixture. Delicious!
Loved it!! Have had lots of requests to make it again.

What a simple but delicious recipe. I have made several times and will be taking this to family 4th of July picnic. I use one fresh pineapple and 1 large can of crushed pineapple. I do cut back on the butter in topping but otherwise make as directed. I like to serve with cinnamon ice-cream. If you can't find it at local supermarket just buy a good quality vanilla, let soften at room temperature, then add a couple TBLS cinnamon or to taste and mix well. Then refreeze. Yummy dessert and simple to make.
Followed recipe exactly. Terrible. Inedible. Dry with little taste except for the ice cream!

I did exactly what the recipe called for and it came out pretty good. Think next time ill use more brown sugar and leas flour as it had more if a over powering flour taste but that couldve been my measuring. But was good and will make again
I added an extra can of pineapple and also added 1/2 cup of rolled oats.

Excellent dessert. I love oats so I added a layer of old fashioned oats on top of fruit and also mixed in oats to the batter mixer. I also used a little of the butter to help mix the batter instead of pouring all of it on top.
I also used fresh pineapple cause I had it.
Turned out fantastic!
I had the swellest time well making this, really enjoyed eating it to. Thank you for sharing this recipe I intend to use it as often as I can(:
I had some fresh pineapple that I added to the canned . It was delicious.
Added granola to fresh pineapple bottom and some to the top.
Just didn't much care for it.

Highly recommend. Very simple fruit dessert recipe and great for a bbq or cookout with ingredients I already have. I used half pineapple and half strawberry and used a simple icing drizzled on top made out of powdered sugar, milk, and vanilla. I plan on using this as a basic recipe for other fruit "cobblers" as well. I was going to use peach and blackberry this time but only have peach and blueberry. Goes great with whatever I throw on the grill for dinner.
Easy, yummy recipe! I think I'll stick to peach or apple crisp in the future though.

I made this for a "new" dessert for Thanksgiving. I added a can of pineapple chunks .I doubled the topping ingredients and in error combined them all together. Continued to spread evenly over top using a 8x11.5x2 pan. Turned out Yummy!
The crumble came out fine. But on the whole the dish was simply unpalatable.

I used about 3/4 cup light brown and 1/2 cup dark because I ran out of light. I only mixed dough, to which I directly added a few shakes of ground cinnamon, until about half of the flour was wet and there were a fair number of clumps. Baked 40 mins. Loved it. Will make again.
Very easy and quick!

Really good. I made a few changes, though. I used fresh pineapple, cut into chunks. I measured 20 oz which was just about one half of a pineapple. I halved the fruit (20 oz instead of 40), butter, and dry ingredients, but used one egg, and added 1/2 cup old fashioned oatmeal to the crumble mixture. I baked this in a 6x6 dish for 40 minutes. This is a wonderfully springtime 'cobbler'. Very easy.
This was my first attempt at a dessert and WOW it was amazing!!!! I can't wait for the leftovers lol

I made it as directed, the topping didn't get smooth (no liquid, only one egg) I tried it anyway....
It smelled good, but it didn't taste good... my friends didn't like it either...

I decided to use half the amount of butter on top just to cut a few calories and if you're careful when you pour it over the crisp it'll cover. Also, I used one 20 oz can of crushed pineapple and half of a 20 oz can of chunked pineapple (chunks spread evenly). Personal preference. 

As well, this crisp is ridiculously tasty and if you like pineapple at all you will be hooked. As in, "I ate the whole pan by myself...Oops!" kinda hooked. So baker beware.
This was really easy, really good and loved by everyone! We were basically licking the pan clean!

Made this exactly as written. Way too dry! Perhaps I drained the pineapple too well, but it was dry as was the topping. Taste is good, but will not make it again. Definitely needed some whipped cream on top to moisten it a bit. Ouch.

I was searching Christmas afternoon for a dessert,as I hadn't properly planned. I had some pineapple that needed to be eaten, so when I came across this, I figured why not! Well, I am so happy I did. This was the best crisp I have ever eaten!! As other reviewers remarked, the topping was a bit dry when mixing, so I added in some veg oil. 
It was crispy, even after being refrigerated. It was so delicious, I had to print the recipe out for the mil. Thanks for a keeper of a recipe.
the top was delicious, I put real pineapples.....yum yum....
This is so easy and delicious especially served warm with ice cream. I also added oatmeal and it was yummy.

This was very good. Not too sweet. I made two changes. I am allergic to cinnamon so I left that out and I used a cup of gluten-free baking mix instead of flour since I can't have it. It still turned out great!

YUM!!! Followed the recipe exactly and WILL make again. I might add some vanilla or almond extract, just for kicks! Other than that, awesome! I served with vanilla frozen yogurt and it's gone, now! (Came out of the oven 15 minutes ago!!!)
I halved this recipe, used fresh pineapple; subbed pineapple juice for the egg. Turned out wonderful !! Thanks for sharing

This was delicious! By far the best crisp topping I've had. I thought maybe just canned crushed pineapple would be dull, but on the contrary - it was wonderful. I did the recipe as is and served warm with top quality vanilla ice cream. I'll try this topping with other fruits too. A keeper!

This was very good but not excellent. I found the topping to be absolutely delicious, but the pineapple portion of the cake was just okay. I think I would have preferred it to be more sweet. I think I'll try making this again with the pineapple in heavy syrup...it might make it more flavorful.

I thought this idea was great, but wanted more of just the "crisp". So I left out the egg and baking powder. Mixed all the ingredients (minus the pineapple) together till it was crumbs. Sprinkle over pineapple. Delicious! I added 1/4 cup rolled oats, also.

"Smooth' is misleading here...'sandy' may be more appropriate when describing the mixed together topping. Be aware, it is not a liquid by any means. I used a combination of diced peaches, plums and cantaloupe for about the same amount as recommended for pineapple. Lovely and different. Everyone ate it up!
Super good. I wouldnt add 1/2 C butter on top, it was way to much. other than that it had a wonderful taste and very moist top. You gotta try this one

My new "go to" dessert! I even made it in individual ramekins for a dinner party. One note is the original recipe says to combine the topping until smooth. With one egg and all of the dry ingredients, I don't know if you'll ever get something smooth. Mine turns into a crumbly mixture so I use all of the butter or else I don't think it would cook properly.
